channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023081108
item.description:
Report X-2023081108

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG ARRIVED AT QA AND WAS WET ON ONE SIDE. IT WAS ALSO ON IT SIDE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS POINTING THE WRONG WAY. PKG WAS PLACED UPRIGHT AND OPENED AND INSPECTED. CAPS ON 1 OF THE 3 JUGS WAS LOOSE. ONCE IT WAS TIGHTENED, PKG WAS SECURED AND INSPECTED FURTHER. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP, NO HOLES IN ANY OF THE JUGS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED UPRIGHT AND CAPS WERE TIGHTENTED. ENTIRE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND SECURED.

DescribePack: The package was very wet when I opened it up I saw where the bottle inside was cracked and broken. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately when I noticed the leaking hazmat I placed it inside of a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081520
item.description:
Report X-2023081520

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA CAGE BY BELT MANAGER, WHO DISCOVERED THAT PKG WAS WET/LEAKING FROM THE BOTTOM OF PKG. UPON INSPECTION, WE NOTICED PIECES OF FOREIGN GLASS IN THE BOX, WHICH PUNTURED 1 OF 4 BOTTLES AND LEAKED ON ALL 4 BOTTLES CONTAIMING ENTIRE PKG. DescribePack: 1/8 IN CUT/PUNTURE IN 1 BOTTLE (IN BODY) DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA TEAM ISOLATED PKG IN LINED HAZMAT TOTE. WE THEN MOVED THE TOTE INTO HAZMAT CAGE UNDERNEATH THE AIR VENT.

item.title: Report I-2023080067
item.description:
Report I-2023080067

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: Durham
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured two drums in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the drum putting a 1/2 inch long puncture in the drum. Drums were then removed and placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

item.title: Report I-2023080066
item.description:
Report I-2023080066

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: Rocky Mount
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A shipment of 2-15 gallon containers of the above mentioned came into the delivery facility and it was noticed that 1 container had a small hole at the bottom of container. the material was inspected and a pinhole leak was detected. the material was refused and the container was over packed in order to be handled by the environmental contractor. Per instruction of shipper the undamaged container was sent back to the shipper

item.title: Report X-2023080841
item.description:
Report X-2023080841

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought over to the QA area by one of our trainers from the load side area. They noticed once the package was pulled from the belt the bottom was wet from leaking. DescribePack: When I got eyes on the package, I saw sure enough the bottom was wet and looked like the bottom was getting to a point of falling apart. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed the box that was falling apart and of course the bottles inside in one of our lined totes in our building.

item.title: Report X-2023080840
item.description:
Report X-2023080840

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was dropped off to our QA work area by one of the managers from the unloads I asked what happened and during unloading the noticed the box was wet. DescribePack: The box had multiple wet spots and had cause box to start to fall apart due to the leaking bottles inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The moment I noticed the leak I immediately placed the leaking box inside of a lined tote to prevent further leaking from occurring.

item.title: Report X-2023080813
item.description:
Report X-2023080813

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the cap was loose on one of the plastic jugs of degreaser causing the contents to leak. The only packaging was a corrugated liner. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080811
item.description:
Report X-2023080811

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was in the process of being loaded when it was mishandled. As a result, two of the four contents inside of the package had loose caps and had leaked inside of the package. The damaged hazmat was placed in a secure bin with a protective liner and was redirected to the QA hazmat area to prevent further damage. DescribePack: Two of the four contents inside of the package had loose caps and had leaked inside of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged hazmat was placed in a secure bin with a protective liner and was redirected to the QA hazmat area to prevent further damage.

item.title: Report X-2023080810
item.description:
Report X-2023080810

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was in the process of being loaded into it's assigned trailer when it was mishandled. As a result, two out of four bottles of 70% isopropyl alcohol had loose caps and leaked inside of the package. Damaged hazmat was placed in secure bin with protective liner and was redirected to QA hazmat area to prevent further damage. DescribePack: Two out of four bottles of 70% isopropyl alcohol had loose caps and leaked inside of the package. Package became wet and was found torn with closures open. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged hazmat was placed in secure bin with protective liner and was redirected to QA hazmat area to prevent further damage.

item.title: Report I-2023080046
item.description:
Report I-2023080046

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: LYNN
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEAST AMALGAMATED INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Tanker truck was traveling westbound on 126. Per the NCSHP report, the trailer tires left the main roadway onto the rumble strip. The driver overcorrected and crashed into the shoulder guardrail. The tanker overturned and caught fire. The Polk Country Fire Dept responded and extinguished the blaze. An environmental response company was engaged and the response company began setting booms to protect waterways and clearing the roadway and shoulder. The remediation work is complete pending final sample analysis and report.

item.description:
Report I-2023080036

  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At the time of unloading, pallet of pails was found crushed and leaking of material. The cause of the spillage was determined to be from top loaded freight that was too heavy. The material was confined to immediate area. The spill was mitigated from further release.

Report X-2023080920

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The plastic Jug of Sulfuric acid had leakage for the cap that spilled everywhere. DescribePack: The plastic jug had a lose cap that spilled all over the within the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a hazmat drum.
